Name: Jagannath Temple, Puri
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 60 km)
Special Notes: One of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites; hosts the world-famous Rath Yatra

Name: Konark Sun Temple, Konark
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 65 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; some areas may be challenging for wheelchair users
Special Notes: UNESCO World Heritage Site; renowned for its chariot-shaped architecture

Name: Chilika Lake, Khurda
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 100 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; some boat rides may not be wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Available; bird watching guides are popular
Nearby Amenities: Local eateries, boat services, and restrooms
Special Notes: Asia's largest brackish water lagoon; a hotspot for migratory birds

Name: Simlipal National Park, Mayurbhanj
Nearest Airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport, Kolkata (Approx. 250 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; some areas may require trekking
Nearby Amenities: Basic accommodations and eateries in Baripada
Special Notes: Known for its tiger and elephant populations; part of the Mayurbhanj Elephant Reserve

Name: Nandankanan Zoological Park, Bhubaneswar
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 20 km)
Guided Tours: Available; audio guides and safari guides
Special Notes: Houses the rare white tiger; part of the Kanjia Lake ecosystem

Name: Daringbadi, Kandhamal
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 250 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; some areas may require trekking
Special Notes: Known as the "Kashmir of Odisha"; famous for its coffee plantations

Name: Chandipur Beach, Balasore
Nearest Airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport, Kolkata (Approx. 200 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; some areas may be challenging for wheelchair users
Special Notes: Known for its unique "vanishing sea" phenomenon during low tide

Name: Lingaraja Temple, Bhubaneswar
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 7 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; some areas may be challenging for wheelchair users
Special Notes: One of the oldest temples in Bhubaneswar; showcases Kalinga architecture

Name: Bhitarkanika National Park, Kendrapara
Nearest Railway Station: Kendrapara Railway Station (Approx. 48 km); Cuttack Junction Railway Station (Approx. 107 km)
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 130 km)
Entry Fee: ₹20 per person; ₹10 per person for groups of 10 or more; ₹10 per student
Best Time to Visit: October–March (winter season; optimal for wildlife sightings)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; boat rides required for interior areas; some areas may not be wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Available; forest guides provided for boat safaris
Nearby Amenities: Basic accommodations and eateries in nearby towns
Special Notes: Known for its saltwater crocodile population; part of Odisha's crocodile conservation efforts

Name: Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves, Bhubaneswar
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 10 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; some areas may be challenging for wheelchair users; involves moderate climbing
Guided Tours: Available; local guides offer historical and architectural explanations in multiple languages
Nearby Amenities: Small eateries, local souvenir shops, restrooms
Special Notes: Famous for Jain and Buddhist rock-cut caves; intricate carvings and inscriptions; popular for history and architecture enthusiasts

Name: Raghurajpur Artist Village, Puri
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 60 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; village paths may be uneven
Guided Tours: Available; local artists often guide and demonstrate Pattachitra painting
Nearby Amenities: Local craft shops, eateries, and small guesthouses
Special Notes: Famous for Pattachitra paintings and traditional crafts; immersive cultural experience

Name: Hirakud Dam, Sambalpur
Nearest Airport: Veer Surendra Sai Airport, Jharsuguda (Approx. 90 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; wheelchairs usable on main paths
Guided Tours: Available; local guides provide dam history and sightseeing info
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, viewpoint areas, and small shops
Special Notes: One of the world’s longest earthen dams; popular for photography and sunset views

Name: Harishankar Falls & Temple, Balangir
Nearest Airport: Veer Surendra Sai Airport, Jharsuguda (Approx. 110 km)
Accessibility: Moderate trekking required to reach falls; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Nearby Amenities: Local eateries, restrooms, and small shops
Special Notes: Scenic waterfall with a historic temple nearby; blend of nature and spirituality

Name: Chandaneswar Shiva Temple, Balasore
Nearest Airport: Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (Approx. 200 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by road; temple complex is flat and walkable
Special Notes: Famous pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Shiva; hosts an annual fair during Maha Shivaratri
